gurmukhi: ds l`K brK pRmwn ]kIA dyv syv mhwn ]ikm hoie moih auDwr ]As dyh dyv ibcwr ]25]
transliteration: Das Lakkh Barakh Pramaan|| Keea Dev Sev Mahaan|| Kim Hoe Moh(i) Udhaar|| As Deh Dev Bichaar||25||
translation: He worshipped the Lord for ten Lakh years and he to the Lord of gods to redeem him in any in any way.25.

gurmukhi: mn ic`q kY kr syv ]qb rIJ hY gurdyv ]qb hoie nwQ snwQ ]jgnwQ dInw nwQ ]26]
transliteration: Man Chitt Kai Kar Sev|| Tab Reejh Hai Gurdev|| Tab Hoe Naath Sanaath|| Jagnaath Deenaa Naath||26||
translation: (Vishnu said) “When you will adore Lord-God with the fullness of your heart, then the Lord who is the support of the helpless, will fulfill you wish.”26.

gurmukhi: sun bYn XO muK cwr ]kIA cauk ic`q ibcwr ]auiT lwigAw hir syv ]ijh BwNq BwKXo dyv ]27]
transliteration: Soun Bain Yau Moukh Chaar|| Keea Chaouk Chitt Bichaar|| Outh(i) Laagiaa Har(i) Sev|| Jih Bhaant Bhakhyo Dev||27||
translation: Hearing this Brahma began to worship and make offerings exactly in the same way, as Vishnu had suggested.27.

gurmukhi: pir pwie cMf pRcMf ]ijh mMf duSt AKMf ]jÍwlwC locn DUm ]hin jws fwry BUm ]28]
transliteration: Par(i) Paae Channd Prachanndd|| Jih Mand Dousht Akhannd|| Jvaalaachh Lochannddhnm|| Han(i) Jaas Ddare Bhoom||28||
translation: Vishnu also said this, that the powerful Chandika, the destroyer of the tyrants should also be adored, who had killed the demons like Jawalaksha and Dhumar Lochan.28

gurmukhi: iqs jwipho jb jwp ]qb hoie pUrn sRwp ]auT lwg kwl jpMn ]hiT iqAwg Awv srMin ]29]
transliteration: Tis Jaaphio Jab Jaap|| Tah Hoe Pooran Sraap|| Outh Laag Jaal Japann|| Hath(i) Tiaag Aav Sarann(i)||29||
translation: “When you will worship all of them, then the curse on you will terminte; worship the unmanifested Brahman and abandoning your persistence; you may go under his shelter.29.

gurmukhi: jy jwq qws srMin ]qy hY Drw mY DMn ]iqn kaun kaunY qRws ]sB hoq kwrj rws ]30]
transliteration: Je Jaat Taas Sarann(i)|| Te Hai Dharaa Mai Dhann|| Tin Kaoun Kaounai Traas|| Sabh Hot Kaaraj Raas||30||
translation: “Blessed are they, on the earth, who go under His refuge; they do not fear anyone and all their tasks are fulfilled.30.

gurmukhi: ds l`C brK pRmwn ]rhXo TwF eyk pgwn ]icq lwie kInI syv ]qb rIJ gy gurdyv ]31]
transliteration: Das Lachchh Barakh Pramaan|| Rahyo Thaadh Ek Pagadn|| Chit Laae Keenisev|| Tab Reejh Ge Gurdev||31||
translation: For ten Lack years Brahma stood on one leg and when he served the Lord with the singleness of his heart, then the Guru-Lord was pleased.31.

gurmukhi: jb Byd dyvI dIn ]qb syv bHmw kIn ]jb syv kI icq lwie ]qb rIJ gy hirrwie ]32]
transliteration: Jab Bhed Devideen|| Tab Sev Brahmaa Keen|| Jab Dev Kichit Laae|| Tab Rujh Ge Har(i)raae||32||
translation: When with the goddess explained the myself, then Brahma served with fullness of his mind, and the unmanifested Bharma was pleased with him.32.

gurmukhi: qb BXo su AYs aucwr ]hau Awih grb pHwr ]mm grb khUM n Cor ]sB kIn jyr mror ]33]
transliteration: Tab Bhyo Su Ais Ouchaar|| Hau Aah(i) Gadab Prahaar|| Man Gadab Kahoon Na Chhodh|| Sabh Keen Jer Daror||33||
translation: Then there was such-like voice from heaven,”I am the masher of pride and I have subjugated all.33.

gurmukhi: qYN grb kIn su kwih ]nih moih Bwvq qwih ]Ab khO eyk ibcwr ]ijm hoie qoih auDwr ]34]
transliteration: Tain Gadab Keen Su Kaah(i)|| Nah(i) Moh(i) Bhaavat Taah(i)|| Ab Kahau Ek Bichaar|| Jim Hoe Toh(i) Udhaar||34||
translation: “You had been puffed up with pride, therefore I did not like you; now I sea this and tell you as to how you will be redeemed.34.

gurmukhi: Dir spq BUm vqwr ]qb hoie qoih auDwr ]soeI mwn bHmw lIn ]Dir jnm jgq nvIn ]35]
transliteration: Dhar(i) Sapat Bhoom Vataar|| Tab Hoe Toh(i) Udhaar|| Soimaan Brahmaa Leen|| Dhar(i) Janam Jagad Naveen||35||
translation: “You may now assume seven incarnation on the earth for your redemption;” Brahma accepted all this and assumed new births in the world.35.

gurmukhi: mur inMd ausqiq qUl ]iem jwn ijX ijn BUl ]iek kho AOr ibcwr ]suin lyhu bHm kumwr ]36]
transliteration: Mur Nind Oustat(i) Tool|| Im Jaan Jiya Jin Bhool|| Ik Kaho Aur Bichaar|| Soun(i) Leh(u) Brahm Koumaar||36||
translation: “Never forget from your mind my slander and praise; O Brahma! Also listen to one thing more; 36.

gurmukhi: iek ibSn moih iDAwn ]bhu syv moih irJwn ]iqn mwNigAw br AYs ]mm dIn qwkhu qYs ]37]
transliteration: Ik Bishan Moh(i) Dhiaan|| Bahu Sev Moh(i) Rijhaan|| Tin Maaniaa Bar Ais|| Mam Deen Taakauh Tais||37||
translation: “A god named Vishnu has also meditated on me and greatly pleased me; he has also asked for a boon from me, which I have bestowed on him.37.
